intro: Thlaspi lerescheanum, commonly known as the alpine cabbages, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine habitats, thriving in cold, high-altitude environments. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a raceme, and its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette. Thlaspi lerescheanum is known for its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
